detail.content: Mobile Devices | NYU School of Law                          Skip to main content                                     ›               Quicklinks       Areas of Study   Calendar   Career Services   Colloquia   Courses   Departments   Directories   Docket   Housing   Library   News and Press   NYU Home   Student Links   Technology                                              JD Admissions   Faculty & Scholarship   Global Opportunities   LLM/JSD Admissions   Academics & Courses   Law & Business   Executive Education   Current Students   Public Service   About NYU Law   Alumni & Giving   Centers & Institutes                               Home › Technology › Help Desk › Mobile Devices                  Technology                 Mobile Devices                 Help Desk       Data Backup   Email Whitelist   ITS Request Instructions   Wireless   Mobile Devices   Software                            Mobile devices allow you to access your NYU resources on the go. Below you will find instructions on how to configure your device to access the NYURoam wireless and NYU email accounts.   For instructions on how to configure and connect your mobile device to NYURoam visit http://www.nyu.edu/its/wireless/configure/ .   For instructions on configuring your NYU Gmail on your mobile device visit http://www.nyu.edu/its/askits/public/041216413245939 .   If you have a Law School Exchange account and wish to configure that on your mobile device, follow the below instructions.   For devices with mobile plans (mainly smartphones), be sure to have an appropriate data plan or you may incur large cell bills by exceeding your data plan. We strongly encourage an unlimited data plan.   Supported Platforms (including smartphones and tablet devices)     iOS   Android   Windows Phone   BlackBerry     iOS (iPhone/iPad)   Setup Instructions   iOS users should make sure to always update your device to the latest software.     From the Home Screen, select Settings > Mail, Contacts, Calendars > Add Account > Microsoft Exchange   Enter your e-mail address, password, and an optional description (Email can be your alias: first.last@nyu.edu or your full exchange account: username@exchange.law.nyu.edu )   Tap Next and the account will verify and prompt you for more information   Enter the server: exchange.law.nyu.edu, domain: lawnyu , and your username   Tap Next   Tap the sliders to turn Mail, Contacts, and Calendar sync on or off. Note: Your phone will prompt you if you want to save or delete any current contacts or calendar items on your phone if you enable Exchange sync for them   Tap Save and allow the phone a few minutes to sync   You may change sync options by tapping Settings > Mail, Contacts, Calendar and then select the account     Android   Setup Instructions     Press the Application Menu button and select Settings   Under Accounts, select Add account   Select Corporate and enter your email address and password   Press next and the phone should attempt to retrieve account information   Update the following information:    Domain\Username: lawnyu\ username   Server: exchange.law.nyu.edu       Press Next and select which items you want to sync (Mail, Contacts, and Calendar)   Press Finish     Windows Phone   Setup Instructions     Go to the Application List and select Settings > email+accounts   Select add an account > advanced setup   Enter your email address and password and press sign in   Select Exchange ActiveSync and update the following information:    User name   Domain: lawnyu   Server: exchange.law.nyu.edu       Select the Content to sync and press sign in     BlackBerry   Helpdesk needs to configure BlackBerry Enterprise Server (BES) on your BlackBerry for you. In order to synchronize your calendar and contact lists and 'push' your emails out faster to you, you need to first verify that you have the necessary level of service with your carrier. Contact Helpdesk to arrange an appointment for installation. Please plan accordingly as installation can take up to a few hours.   BlackBerry data plans that support BES (You should confirm with your service provider that your data plan is compatible with BES since the below information may change at any time)     Verizon: Any BlackBerry Data Plan   AT&T: DataPro Enterprise Plan   Sprint: Any BlackBerry Data Plan   T-Mobile: BlackBerry Enterprise Plan                                                    Facebook   Twitter   YouTube   Instagram   Visitor Information   Directories   Offices and Departments   Site Map   NYU School of Law                   Prospective Info   Admissions (JD) Admissions (LLM/JSD) Areas of Study Degrees Offered Faculty Profiles Campus Map  Academics   Academic Sitemap Course Descriptions Class Schedules NYU Classes Clinics Academic Calendars  Departments   Academic Services Career Services Financial Aid Graduate Affairs (LLM) Hospitality and Events Housing Human Resources Library Operations and Facilities Records and Registration Student Affairs  Tools and Resources   About the Law School Campus Map Directories Law School News Journals Picture Book                      © 2015 New York University School of Law. 40 Washington Sq. South, New York, NY 10012. Tel. (212) 998-6100

Locations & Facilities                 //         NYU Print Service                                            NYU Print Service                       search the site                                                                      IT Service Desk      1-212-998-3333     24 hours, 7 days a week     Email: AskITS@nyu.edu      www.nyu.edu/servicelink         related pages           ITS Academic Technology Center and CoLabs: Locations, hours, resources       NYU Campus Cash & Campus Cash Value Transfer Stations       Departmental Copy Cards       Printing at NYU Law       Bobst Library Print Service       Sustainability at NYU                        About     Instructions for use     General information     Troubleshooting     Benefits              About the NYU Print Service    NYU Print Service is an easy-to-use, two-step process that broadens your printing options while also conserving resources and helping the environment.    To use the service at any NYU Print Service-enabled location , you tag your document (establish ownership) and send it to your personal NYU Print Service queue using any computer connected to NYU-NET, including those at the ITS Academic Technology Centers and CoLabs in New York. Then you go to any NYU Print Station; swipe or tap your NYUCard (or, optionally, a Bobst Library Print Card if in New York); and print your document on the adjacent printer.        Instructions for use    Please consult the ServiceLink Knowledge Base for instructions on how to use the NYU Print Service:         Setting up a personal Windows computer     Setting up a personal Mac computer     Printing from a Windows computer     Printing from a Mac computer            General information     Please consult the ServiceLink Knowledge Base for additional information about the NYU Print Service:        Printing costs and payment options     Print Grant amount and eligibility     Print Station locations     Using a Bobst Library Print Card for NYU Print Service charges     Buying or addding funds to a Bobst Library Print Card     Adding funds to your Campus Cash account     Checking Print Grant, Campus Cash, and Bobst Print Card balance     Rolling over Print Grant to new or replacement NYUCard     Reducing printing charges and conserving paper     Printing double-sided and printing multiple pages per sheet             Troubleshooting    Please consult the ServiceLink Knowledge Base for troubleshooting tips:         Job not appearing in print queue     Unable to print due to 'not in system' error     NYUCard rejected at Print Service station     Document damaged during printing     Printer crashes when printing in Microsoft Word for Mac     Print Grant exhausted     Jobs do not appear on printer terminal when submitting from MS Office for Windows            Benefits    Convenience & ease-of-use . With the new NYU Print Service, you can print your documents where and when you wish to print them. No guessing — the printer is always right near the Print Station that you choose to use. Each document stays in your Print Service queue for up to 24 hours waiting for you to print it, and it won’t be printed until you’re right there, ready to pick it up.    Efficient & green . The NYU Print Service also supports the University’s efficiency and green initiatives by encouraging double-sided and more selective printing. By printing only what you need, and using some savvy printing tips , you can conserve your print grant, keep your printing costs low, and help reduce paper waste by 30 percent!       Page last reviewed: February 4, 2015

2:00 pm      Where:                19 University Place, Great Room                    Summary:        Tap Into University Resources for Technology-Enhanced Education Thursday, April 16, 12:30-2:00pm | Location: 19 University Place, Great Room      Details:        Tap Into University Resources for Technology-Enhanced Education   Thursday, April 16, 12:30-2:00pm  |   Location: 19 University Place, Great Room  |   REGISTER   Join us for a fun and informative workshop showcasing the self-service tools and services supported by the University.  Learn about best practices on how to use NYU Classes, NYU Stream, Google Apps for Education, and more! Featuring staff from Academic Technology Services and Global Technology Services.
